marketNews.title: Government Deregulates Import Policies & Business Facilitation
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Trade has officially issued several regulations in order to deregulate import policies and facilitate business. The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, stated that this step is in line with Indonesia's accession process to the OECD, the negotiation of the Indonesia European Union Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (IEU-CEPA), and negotiations with the US regarding non-tariff barriers.

marketNews.title: Deregulation of Import Policies
marketNews.content: Technically, the Ministry of Trade revoked Ministerial Regulation of Trade (Permendag) Number 36 of 2023 jo. Number 8 of 2024 and amended it by issuing Permendag Number 16, 17, 18, 19, 20, 21, 22, 23, and 24 of 2025. The Minister of Trade, Budi Susanto, stated that there are 4 groups of priority goods relaxed [see table]. Budi also mentioned that this deregulation package is the first package and may be followed by a second package. Meanwhile, the Vice Minister of Finance, Anggito Abimanyu, stated that this deregulation step will be supported by faster and more integrated import supervision with the system. The Ministry will also accelerate the duration of the implementation of remedial tariffs (protection) for certain products from 40 days to 14 days.

marketNews.title: Deregulation of Business Facilitation Policies
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Trade also eased things for franchise owners through the issuance of Permendag Number 25 of 2025. Through this regulation, franchise owners can start operating even if the regional government has not yet issued a permit within 5 days of submitting the Franchise Registration Certificate (STPW). Previously, franchise owners needed to wait for the issuance of the STPW before conducting business activities.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Based on existing regulations, related importers generally need an import approval (PI) which usually has a validity period of up to 1 year. Therefore, import relaxation by removing the need for PI potentially offers ease and flexibility for importers.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics You Need to Know...
marketNews.content: 1. The Minister of Finance, Sri Mulyani, stated that the realization of state revenue in 1H25 only reached 1,201.8 trillion IDR (-9% YoY), equivalent to only 40% of the 2025 State Budget target and marking the lowest achievement in the last 3 years. For comparison, state revenue realization in 1H24 was equivalent to 47% of the 2024 State Budget target, in 1H23 was equivalent to 57% of the 2023 State Budget target, and in 1H22 was equivalent to 59% of the 2022 State Budget target. Sri Mulyani explained that this decline was caused by weakening commodity prices, the transfer of State-Owned Enterprise dividends to BPI Danantara, and the cancellation of the 12% VAT implementation. 2. The Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated that the government plans to cut the duration of mining quotas (Work Plan and Budget/RKAB) from 3 years to 1 year. This step is aimed at improving governance in the mining sector and as an effort to better control the supply of coal and ore. Previously, the RKAB was set annually, but the government changed it to once every 3 years in 2023 for administrative convenience. 3. The US tax cut and state spending bill amounting to 3.3 trillion US dollars proposed by US President Donald Trump was passed by the US Senate on Tuesday (1/7). Previously, the US House of Representatives passed the Bill on May 22, 2025, and currently, the Bill will return to the House for final approval after amendments from the US Senate. If approved by the US House, this Bill will provide a tax cut of 4.5 trillion US dollars and a state spending cut of 1.2 trillion US dollars. 4. The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has issued Ministerial Regulation No. 14/2025 to attract investment from oil drilling technology providers to increase production from existing wells. Based on the new policy, oil and gas block operators will be allowed to partner with technology providers to increase production from old or idle wells or fields, which often receive less focus from operators as they prioritize new, more economical wells. The Vice Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Yuliot Tanjung, stated that the government has identified approximately 2,500 wells and more than 100 fields or structures that can be opened by operators to partner with technology providers. 5. Bloomberg reported that PT Pertamina and its subsidiary, PT Pertamina International Shipping, are seeking an overseas loan of around 700 million US dollars with a tenor of approximately 10 years for vessel construction. Bloomberg sources mentioned that the details of the agreement may change because discussions with lenders are still in the early stages. 6. Bumi Resources announced that Yingbin Ian He and Jinping Ma have submitted their resignations from their respective positions as directors and commissioners of the company.

tickerNews.title: TOWR Plans Rights Issue at Premium Price
tickerNews.content: Sarana Menara Nusantara plans to hold a rights issue of up to approximately 8.1 billion new shares at an exercise price of 680 rupiah per share, with a ratio of 619:100, and a dilution effect of up to 13.91%. This exercise price is +24% higher than the TOWR share price as of Wednesday (2/7). The potential funds raised from this corporate action reach approximately 5.5 trillion rupiah, which is intended for capital injection to its subsidiary, PT Profesional Telekomunikasi Indonesia (Protelindo), to pay off all and/or part of its principal debt. PT Dwimuria Investama Andalan has stated it will be the standby buyer, while the company's controller - PT Sapta Adhikari Investama - will not exercise its rights. After the rights issue, PT Dwimuria Investama Andalan's ownership in TOWR is potentially to increase from 8.33% to 20.86%. The rights trading period runs from July 14-18, 2025.

tickerNews.title: LPLI Sells Stake in NOBU
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Bank Nationalnobu, Star Pacific (LPLI), sold approximately 384.5 million shares (5.14%) of NOBU at a price of 1,110 rupiah per share on June 26, 2025, which is +67% higher compared to the NOBU share price as of Wednesday (2/7) at the level of 665 rupiah per share. The total transaction value reached approximately 427 billion rupiah. After this transaction, LPLI's ownership in NOBU decreased from 13.45% to 8.31%. Previously, NOBU announced that a number of the company's shareholders - including LPLI - had divested a total of 40% of NOBU shares to Hanwha Life Insurance Co. Ltd. This divestment plan was announced since January 2025.

tickerNews.title: PGEO Commences Commercial Operations for Lumut Balai Unit 2
tickerNews.content: Pertamina Geothermal Energy announced that it has commenced commercial operations for the Lumut Balai Geothermal Power Plant (PLTP) unit 2 in South Sumatra. This PLTP unit has a capacity of 55 MW, bringing the total capacity at Lumut Balai to 110 MW. With this addition, PGEO now manages an installed capacity of 727.5 MW from 6 operating areas.

tickerNews.title: MINA Plans Rights Issue at 50 Rupiah per Share
tickerNews.content: Sanurhasta Mitra plans to hold a rights issue of up to approximately 3.3 billion new shares at an exercise price of 50 rupiah per share, with a ratio of 2:1, and a dilution effect of up to 33.33%. The potential funds raised from this corporate action reach approximately 164.1 billion rupiah, which will be used for the working capital of the company and its subsidiaries. The company's controller, Hapsoro, will exercise all of his rights and is committed to taking and exercising the rights received from PT Basis Utama Prima. After this corporate action, Hapsoro's direct ownership in MINA is potentially to increase from 4.44% to 19.68%. The rights trading and exercise period will take place from July 14-25, 2025.

tickerNews.title: KRYA Shareholders Negotiate Sale to Rich Step International Ltd.
tickerNews.content: Bangun Karya Perkasa Jaya announced that the company's shareholders - consisting of PT Bangun Karya Artha Lestari, Hok Gwan (Dharmo Budiono), Brigitta Notoatmodjo, and Pramana Budihardjo - are undergoing negotiations for the sale of KRYA shares to Rich Step International Ltd. The transaction value has not been announced. After this transaction is completed, Rich Step International Ltd. will become the new controller of the company. KRYA explained that this planned share acquisition is aimed at the company's business development.

tickerNews.title: Darma Henwa Sells Stake in DEWA
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Darma Henwa, PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara, sold approximately 666.7 million DEWA shares on June 19, 2025, at an undisclosed price. DEWA explained that the company is unaware of the purpose of this transaction. After this transaction, PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara's ownership in DEWA decreased from 23.59% to 21.96%. Previously, PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara had also sold approximately 493 million shares (1.22%) of DEWA at a price of 75 rupiah per share in April 2025.
